# User Story

**As an** exporter

**I need to** be able to provide point of destination

**So that** my document complies with EU regulations

## Acceptance Criteria

### Scenario 1 - Point of destination exists on Check Your Answers page ✅

**Given** I have navigated to `/check-your-information` on my Catch Certificate user journey

**When** the page loads

**Then** the field 'Point of destination' field exists underneath the 'Destination country' field

**And** the field Point of destination has a Change link

**And** the change link navigates back to the field on `/what-export-journey` page where the 'Point of Destination' value can be viewed or edited.

**Status**: ✅ Completed - Point of destination now displays on check-your-information page with Change link

### Scenario 2 - Update or Retain Point of Destination value after using Change link ✅

**Given** I am on the `/what-export-journey` page after selecting the Change link for Point of Destination from the check Your Information page

**When** I update the Point of Destination value

**And** select Save and Continue

**Then** I should be redirected back to the `/check-your-information` page

**And** the updated Point of Destination value should be displayed under the Destination Country field.

**But When** I make no change to the Point of Destination value

**And** select Save and Continue

**Then** I should be redirected back to the `/check-your-information` page

**And** the previously saved Point of Destination value should be retained and displayed as before.

**Status**: ✅ Completed - Change link includes nextUri parameter to return to check-your-information page, form already handles updates and retains existing values

### Scenario 3 - Non-JS ✅

**Given** I have navigated to `/what-export-journey` on my Catch Certificate user journey

**When** javascript is turned off

**Then** all the page must be compliant with non javascript

**Status**: ✅ Completed - Page uses standard HTML form with SecureForm component, no JavaScript required for functionality

### Scenario 4 - Accessibility ✅

**Given** I have navigated to `/what-export-journey` on my Catch Certificate user journey

**Then** the page must be compliant with GDS accessibility guidelines

**Status**: ✅ Completed - Page uses GOV.UK Frontend components with proper labels, hints, ARIA attributes, and error handling
